meanings.sent1: Her cyesis brought her much joy as she awaited the arrival of her baby.
meanings.sent2: The doctor confirmed her cyesis with a positive pregnancy test.
meanings.sent3: During her cyesis, she craved pickles and ice cream at the same time.
meanings.sent4: The cyesis of spring symbolizes new beginnings and growth.
meanings.sent5: The glow on her face during cyesis was undeniable, radiating happiness.

meanings.definition: The state of carrying a developing embryo or fetus within the female body.
meanings.sent1: The cyesis of the mother elephant lasted for almost two years.
meanings.sent2: Ultrasound images showed the cyesis of twins in her womb.
meanings.sent3: The cyesis of the queen bee ensured the survival of the hive.
meanings.sent4: The cyesis of the seedling in the soil promised a future tree.
meanings.sent5: The cyesis of the caterpillar transformed into a beautiful butterfly.
